lexUnit.name: drain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause the water or other liquid in (something) to run out, leaving it empty or dry.

sentence.text: One well in Bondgate stank so much that when it was drained the decomposed body of a three-month-old baby was found .
I can only liken this to a trance-like state which neither drains you of energy nor leaves you feeling elated afterwards . "
She averted her eyes , draining the glass of fruit juice in one gulp .
It drains humanity of its humour , reduces adults ' behaviour to that of petulant children .
He walked to the table where he 'd left his brandy snifter , lifted it , and drained it of liquid .
She had no idea of how she might use it : draining him of pity would be worse than draining him of money , and she would drown in guilt .

` Thanks , " Cheryl said , and to Bernice 's amazement , drained the entire flask without stopping for breath .
Bull O'Malley chuckled and drained his glass .

In some places marshes are being drained in order to farm the land .

Drain the pasta and toss well in the sauce .
